account_required.title: Account Required
account_required.text: A Pledgecamp account is required to proceed. Click below to login!

image_upload.browse_file: Or browse to choose a file

home.intro_title: We redesigned crowdfunding and took the worry out.
home.intro_desc:
We give creators more support and
structure. And give backers more protection.
home.subtitle: Pledgecamp has the tools and features to make dream projects a reality for backers and creators. From setting up a fundraising campaign to ordering a life-changing product, we have covered.
home.storefront_title: Open a post funding storefront or start a new campaign
home.storefront_desc1: Were you successful with a crowdfunding campaign? Then use us as a storefront for your post-funding products!
home.storefront_desc2: Ready to take the first step in funding your dream project? Did your campaign fall short on anonther crowdfunding platform? Either way, Pledgecamp has the features and support to get your project to the next level.
home.creator_backer_desc1: We charge lower fees, provide more support, and can even be your post-funding storefront. We have the workflow tools and knowledge-base to get your dream project in the hands of your customers
home.creator_backer_desc2: More support for creators means you get your rewards more often, and on time. You also have Backer Protection. Which means you can vote to cancel projects you’ve backed and get a refund — if you lose faith in them.

articles.text: Randi Zuckerberg, Ripple And TechCrunch Execs Advise New $17 Million Blockchain Startup
Randi Zuckerberg aims to disrupt crowdfunding with blockchain technology

home.explore_title: A crowdfunding platform made for creators, by creators
home.explore_desc: We've been there, so we know exactly what you need. From how to set up your campaign to the best way to wrap your product and drop it in the mail. Because the goal isn't just to fundraise - it's to get your product out there.
home.subscribe_title: Be the first to know about new Pledgecamp projects.
home.featured_storefront_desc: Funded projects ready to be shipped to your home.

about.title: About Us

who.title: Who We Are
who.mission_text: To bring effective, reliable crowdfunding to every corner of the globe. We pledge to support creators funding their dreams and to protect backers with features that emphasize accountability.
who.history_text:
Online crowdfunding is a recent phenomenon (~2010), yet its impacts have already changed the world. Our team has been crowdfunding since 2014 and followed its evolution every step of the way.

For every success story like the Oculus Rift, there are countless more (avoidable) failures. A Wharton University professor found that oer 85% of projects break their promises, and less than 33% of supporters return back to a second project.

Crowdfunding, for all its promise, is broken. Pledgecamp is here to fix it. We teamed up with the makers of Slack and Coinbase to make Pledgecamp fun and easy-to-use, and enlisted top advisors to get us to the next level.

The next generation of crowdfunding is here. Join us.

about.connect_text: Follow us on any social media platform to stay updated with all our latest news.

quotes.name: - Matt Curcio | VP Data at Ripple
quotes.text: They are founders that really want to make a difference, and they really picked a problem I found interesting.

quotes.name: - Jim Augustine | COO at Zuckerberg Media
quotes.text: “Pledgecamp knows what it's doing, it's taking blockchain to a place that can be really useful in a society.

quotes.name: - Keith Teare | Founding Shareholder at TechCrunch
quotes.text: In this team I'm seeing a track record of execution.

quotes.name: - Randi Zuckerberg | Founder at Zuckerberg Media
quotes.text: Pledgecamp will give millions of entrepreneurs a new opportunity to connect globally around their projects.

quotes.name: - Edward Kim
quotes.text: You’re looking for strong teams that can actually execute and that understand how to create value for the token on their platform.

quotes.name: - Christian Sullivan | LP at Polychain Capital
quotes.text: This is the product of a lot of work and time that they put into and I think if someone’s gonna get it done they’ll get it.

quotes.name: Ryan Scott | Founding Partner of ICL impact group
quotes.text: In relations to the many other blockchain projects I’ve seen especially in terms of crowdfunding, this project stands head and shoulders above the rest.

whitepaper.title: Whitepaper
whitepaper.info_text: Our whitepaper is a thorough explanation of our philosophy and solutions to the problems facing crowdfunding today. Download our whitepaper in the language of your choice for more details about our origins, market analysis, platform design, token economy, and more.

campaign.backer_protection_desc: Your refund if a project hits a snag post-fundraising.
campaign.timeline_desc: These are major events in the project plan that unlock portions of funding for the creator. As a backer you’ll be able to vote before each milestone unlocks.
campaign.referral_desc: Earn a 5% referral bonus when a friend makes a pledge to this project with your referral link.
campaign.report_desc: Does this project seem suspicious? Is it breaking a Pledgecamp rule? Let us know.

trust.vote_positive: You've voted to use your Backer's Protection.
trust.vote_negative: You haven't voted to use your Backer's Protection.
trust.backed: You backed this project with a {0} pledge on {1}.
trust.tooltip: Backer's Protection is the refund you get if more than 50% of backers vote that they don't have confidence in the project.

vote_modal.title: Change your Vote
vote_modal.content: You can change your vote anytime after funding. If 50% or more backers vote they don't have confidence in the project, all backers will receive the refund guaranteed by the Backer's Protection.
vote_modal.info: Your projected refund if the project was canceled today. The refund is based on the 10% backer protection.
vote_modal.change_vote: Change My Vote to Support the Project

handbook.descript: Use our handy tutorials and guides to set up your perfect project page.

updates.title: Updates
updates.empty: You haven't posted any updates yet!
updates.reasons: Updates are a great way to keep backers in the loop, confident about your project, and excited. Use updates to celebrate milestones and to celebrate all the little things in between.
updates.best: What are some best practices for using updates?
updates.tell: Tell backers what is going on in the project.
updates.best_give: What are some best practices for giving updates?
updates.add_email: Add your update to your milestone email
updates.email_info: You can add this update to your email to give backers more details.
updates.audience: Choose who can see your update. Is this for a specific audience?
updates.receive: Choose who can receive an email
updates.backers: Which backers should receive an email about your update? Does it focus on a specific reward?

agreement.title: Welcome to Pledgecamp!
agreement.content: If you have a new project to list or even just a startup idea, don't hesitate to contact us at hello@pledgecamp.com. We're here to help.

intro_type.title2: What kind of project are you setting up?

items.title: New Project
items.text: Set a funding goal and raise funds

items.title: Continuing Pre-Orders
items.text: For funded Kickstarter and Indiegogo projects

intro_name.title: What's the name of your project?
intro_name.description: Give your project a clear, intriguing name. This is what backers will see and call your project. You can change it later.

intro_category.title: Choose a category
intro_category.desc: Don't see your category? Not sure which category you fall in to?

intro_eligibility.title: Let's check your eligibility
intro_eligibility.desc: We'll ask for your documents in a later step

checks.label: I have a bank account and a government ID.
I have a debit/and or credit card.
I agree to Pledgecamp's Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy

info.title: Basic Info
info.name: Project name
info.subdescript: Briefly tell people what your project is.

placeholders.upload: Drag and drop your image here, or press button below
placeholders.uploadvideo: Drag and drop your video here, or press button below

insurance.title: Backer Insurance
insurance.subtitle: Decide what percentage of funds to withhold until the backer confidence vote. More backer insurance means lower listing fees.
insurance.label: Backer insurance

milestone.title: Project Milestones
milestone.subtitle: Milestones
milestone.instructions: Milestones indicate important steps in your project to potential and active backers. You control how much funding you'll receive at each step. This helps add confidence for backers knowing goals have to be met for the project to move forward.
milestone.amount: Enter the amount you'll need for this milestone, and see how it affects the project fee.

placeholders.title: Title
placeholders.description: Description: Try to state any goals, outputs, and deliverables.

dashboard.save_warning: If you continue, you may lose unsaved changes

manage_team.invite: Invite people to help manage your project and page.

roles.title: Can Edit
roles.desc: Access to project creation and most settings

roles.title: Admin
roles.desc: Full access including withdrawal of funds

basics.title: Basics
basics.desc: This is the nuts and bolts of your project: title, short description, image, etc.

project_name.title: Project Title
project_name.desc: Name your project something clear and interesting.

blurb.title: Description
blurb.desc: This should be short and sweet and tell your backers how great your project is. This description could appear as a snippet on the Pledgecamp homepage or category page, so make it intriguing.

category.title: Category
category.desc: Choose the closest fit for your category, so backers can easily find you.

location.title: Location
location.desc: Show backers where you're from, so locals can help promote and fund your project. Enjoy some hometown pride!

main_image.title: Your main project image
main_image.desc: Add an image that shows off what you're creating. Tip: this image will be used in a lot of places, including the homepage. Make sure it works for multiple places and multiple sizes.
main_image.note: 3x5 aspect ratio900 x 1200 px minimum.png or .jpg

video.title: Video
video.desc: Tip: Backers love videos! They make projects more successful.

carousel.title: Images carousel
carousel.desc: Upload additional images to help backers see what you're making.

social.title: Social media image
social.desc: Choose the image you want to show up when you or someone else shares a link on social media.
social.note: 1.9x1 aspect ratio600 x 314 px minimum.png or .jpg

goal.title: Your fundraising goal
goal.desc: The minimum you need to fundraise to launch your project.

length.title: Campaign length
length.desc: How many days will your campaign last? This is just the fundraising portion. It's not the delivery of your project.

post.title: Post-campaign funding
post.desc: Offer new rewards after your campaign ends. Use this to capture ongoing demand.
post.note: Note: You need to ship to your original backers first. Post-campaign funding should be a bonus and not the center of your project.

referral.title: Referral links
referral.desc: Give backers a link to share and refer friends. If a backer's friend funds you from that link, the original backer gets a referral bonus. The bonus is paid out of the money you earn in your campaign. You choose what the bonus is.
referral.note: Backers will see the info on referral bonuses at the bottom of your project page.

analytics.title: Google Analytics
analytics.desc: Monitor your progress and watch the traffic roll in through Google Analytics.
analytics.link: How do I get my Google Analytics tracking code?

overview.title: Overview
overview.desc: Explain in detail why your project is great and why backers will love it.

main.title: Describe your project and your journey
main.desc: Describe your project and explain how it will make backers' lives better. Be sure to add a little about yourself and why you've launched this campaign - so backers will root for your success.

rewards.title: Rewards
rewards.desc: What are you going to give your backers? How much will they need to pledge?
rewards.rewards_text1: Select items and experiences for backers. Try to provide rewards at different price points, so everyone can support you.
rewards.rewards_text2: Users can pick multiple rewards to put in their cart and back you.
rewards.shipping_text1: Create special shipping rates for large orders and bundles
rewards.shipping_quantity_text: Select a reward and then customize quantity and shipping rates for each quantity level.
rewards.shipping_bundle_text: Create a bundle to customize shipping rates and total item costs for each shipping destination.

labels.variations_desc: Show all the options for your rewards (likes size and color), so backers can easily see all their choices. List a reward with all its variations, rather than creating multiple rewards.
labels.shipping_desc: Add your shipping estimates per country and/or worldwide.

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.desc: Your project plan for creating and shipping your product. Don't worry if you're new to this! we can help.
timeline.page_desc: Lay out your project plan. Start with creating a milestone, these are specific goals or activities you need to complete after funding wraps up.
timeline.link: Need help with your project timeline?
timeline.right_desc: The more funding you set aside for milestones, the lower the project fee.

milestones.instructions: Enter the amount you'll need for your first milestone, and see how this affects the project fee.

account.title: Account
account.desc: Confirm your identity and your banking info. We need this information to make sure you get your funding.

email.title: Contact Email
email.desc: The email used for project related messages. If you'd like to change your email address, visit your Profile Settings.

2fa.title: Two-Factor Authentication
2fa.desc: Use an authenticator app for better account security.

contact.title: Contact and Personal Information
contact.desc: This is the primary contact's information. ID and images need to match this.

bank_details.title: Bank Details
bank_details.desc: We need this info so we can deposit your funds.
bank_details.link: Where do I find these numbers?

bank_confirmation.title: Bank Confirmation
bank_confirmation.desc: Upload a bank document like a voided check, direct deposit form, or screenshot of your online banking info. The documents need to include your full name, bank logo, transit number, and your account number.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.desc: Answer common questions before they happen.

bonuses.title: Bonuses
bonuses.desc: Ask for help on your project in exchange for Pledge Coin.

projects.projects_false: Have an idea for a project?

labels.name: Name
labels.choose_image: Choose or drop an image here
labels.file_type: JPEG, PNG, or GIF • 2MB file limit

activity.remember_vote_description: Voting process is an important part of each project. Make sure to support the creator by voting at each milestone.
activity.no_backed_projects: You haven't backed any projects yet.

email.title: Email
email.label: We use your email to send you updates on your projects.

two_factor.title: Two Factor
two_factor.label_authenticator: Add a layer of security. Every time you log in, we'll ask you to enter a code provided by a third party Authenticator application.
two_factor.label_phone: Your phone needs to be verified to use this. Update it in the Trust and Verification tab, if you haven't done this already.

pair_app.title: Pair App to your Account
pair_app.desc: Scan the QR code to pair to mobile device.

enter_digits.title: Enter 6-digit verification
enter_digits.desc: Enter the code from your authenticator app.

almost_done.title: Almost Done!
almost_done.desc: To enable two-factor, you must download your recovery codes. Keep these recovery codes in a safe place. If you lose your two factor enabled device, these one-time use codes can be used in the listed order to log in to your account.

process_complete.title: Process Complete
process_complete.desc: Your two-factor aunthentication is now enabled. The next time you log in you will be asked to provide a verification code. You can disable this feature at any time.

social.title: Connected Accounts
social.label: Linking accounts makes it easy to share with people you already know and see what they're up to on Pledgecamp.

payment.title: Credit / Debit Cards
payment.help: Add and manage your credit or debit cards here for convenience. They will be accessible during checkout when you make pledges.

top.title: Be Ready to Create Projects
top.desc: For safety and trust, we require all creators to verify their identity before submitting a project. Get a head start by doing this now.

email.title: Email Confirmation
email.desc: Check your email and confirm your email address. If you’d like to change your email address, visit your Profile Settings.

contact_info.title: Contact and Personal Information
contact_info.desc: This is the primary contact’s information. ID and images need to match this.

kyc.title: “Know Your Customer” (KYC) Verification
kyc.desc: Click the button below to begin the KYC process. You will be taken to our partner Veriff's website, and returned here once complete.

address_verification.title: Address Verification
address_verification.desc: Upload your proof of residential address. This can be a recent utility bill, bank statement, or government issued ID.

content.success: Click the button below to begin the KYC process. You will be taken to our partner Veriff's website, and returned here once complete.
content.no_contact: Please fill in your contact information before starting KYC!
content.url_fail: The KYC provider is unavailable at the moment, please try again later!
content.remove_confirmation: Are you sure to remove your KYC?

subscriptions.title: Email Notifications
subscriptions.desc: Check your email and confirm your email address. If you’d like to change your email address, visit your Profile Settings.

learn.title: Have a question? Our experts can help.

wallet.moderator_status_not_achieved: You have not achieved Moderator Status

checkout.title: Checkout
checkout.note_text: You will not be charged until the funding period is over, and only if the project has met its goal.

success.whats_next_desc: We'll let you know as soon as the project's funded! And then we'll give you updates of the project's progress.
success.voting_desc: Once the project is funded, you can get a refund by voting with other backers. Check out the project's timeline to learn more.

userMenu.backed_projects: Backed Projects | 1 Backed Project | {count} Backed Projects

footer.pledgecamp_desc: Pledgecamp is a community of people funding and launching creative projects.
